name: top_bar_app_button
objective: Check that top bar Applications button switches the desktop to Application mode
description: Clicking on the status bar button "Applications" must toggle the windowing area in Application mode.

steps.description: click on "Applications" button in top bar
steps.expected: display has switched to application mode

author: sdx

name: zones
objective: The Application mode must follow the design guidelines
description:
The application mode screen must contain:
- a search sidebar on the left, with search field and categories (width is 2 tiles)
- a zone at the bottom for displaying current applications (scrollable, each application takes 2x2 tiles)
- a zone showing the applications found (the rest of the tiles on top left)
See Design document, page 10

steps.description: click on "Applications" button in top bar
steps.expected: search sidebar must be present on the left
current applications bar is present at the bottom
applications search results is present on top right

author: sdx

name: filters
objective: Check application filters / category list appearance
description:
The search zone must contain:
- a smart filter field on the top to type application name patterns
- below a list of categories, with radio buttons
- special categories "Most used","Recently downloaded" and "Running Applications" should be displayed at the bottom of the list with a separator

steps.expected: must contain the elements defined in the description

author: sdx

name: app_icons
description:
The matching applications must be displayed in the result zone.

Applications icons and names must appear as they do on desktop (icon must have a size of 48x48 and application names must be shown below icon). Each application occupies 1 tile exactly.

steps.expected: icons are properly displayed (correct size), with names under the icon (readable)

author: sdx

name: app_icons_pagination
description: If the applications view requires more than 1 screen to display the applications, two arrows must appear in the top border to allow pagination.

steps.description: select all applications (on search sidebar, select categories
steps.expected: "all" ) => all applications must appear in the results area and 2 arrows for pagination must be created to browse the result pages

author: sdx
